result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E Hildebrandt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

Defendant shall not physically discipline any children.

Defendant shall have contact with his biological children only as allowed by probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Def in person & by Atty John David Dries.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Resolution reached.  State moves to amend sole count to two misd. counts of disorderly conduct pursuant to sec. 947.01(1) and Court so orders.  No contest plea entered Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. and Ct. 2 as amended.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
